alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 1:30PM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow and very strong winds expected above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph will cause blizzard like conditions, regardless of snowfall accumulations. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Grand Canyon and North Rim. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow with blizzard like conditions are likely. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage and power outages. Snow forecast from 9 PM Today to 11 PM Wednesday: Grand Canyon 4 to 6 inches North Rim 7 to 11 inches
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
